title: Replace green color theme with royal blue across the entire website

requirements.text: Replace all green color values with royal blue (#1a4fa0) and its tonal variants across the entire website. This includes: the Navigation bar background and logo accent, the Hero section background/gradient overlay, all CTA and action buttons, the Why Choose Us section icon accents and card hover highlights, the Testimonials section background (currently dark green), the Footer background, all section heading underlines and accent decorators, hover states, border accents, and any other element currently using green. Update the CSS custom properties in frontend/src/index.css, the Tailwind config brand colors in frontend/tailwind.config.js, and all inline/className color references in each component file (Navigation.tsx, HeroSection.tsx, AboutSection.tsx, WhyChooseUsSection.tsx, TestimonialsSection.tsx, GallerySection.tsx, ContactSection.tsx, Footer.tsx, App.tsx). Ensure the new blue palette is visually consistent and professional: use a dark royal blue (#1a4fa0) as the primary brand color, a lighter blue (#2563eb or similar) for hover/accent states, and a deep navy (#0f2d6b or similar) for dark section backgrounds (replacing dark green). White remains the background and text-on-color remains white.

quotes: replacing all green colors with royal blue (#1a4fa0) across the entire website right now

acceptanceCriteria: No green color values (#1a7a3c, #166534, or similar) remain in any component, CSS, or Tailwind config file
Navigation bar uses royal blue background (#1a4fa0 or close variant)
Hero section background/gradient uses royal blue
All buttons use royal blue with appropriate hover states in a lighter or darker blue
Testimonials section dark background is replaced with deep navy blue instead of dark green
Footer background is replaced with deep navy blue instead of dark green
Section accent underlines, card icon colors, and hover highlights all use blue variants
Tailwind config brand color tokens are updated to blue values
CSS custom properties in index.css are updated to blue values
The website remains fully mobile-responsive after the color change
White text on blue backgrounds remains legible throughout

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/main.tsx
